title: Sharlto Copley and the Allegory Defense in Our Woke World
sub_head: The ‘District 9’ actor portrayed a bureaucrat persecuting aliens. Literal aliens, not the undocumented kind.
body:
In Joe Morgenstern’s review of “Ted K” (Film Review, Feb. 18), we read that the star, Sharlto Copley, played a South African white supremacist in the movie “District 9.”
While conventional wisdom holds that “District 9” was an allegory for South Africa’s racial strife, it was not a movie about racism. In a woke world, one would hate for Mr. Copley to have to explain himself for portraying a white supremacist when in fact he did not. He portrayed a bureaucrat persecuting aliens. Literal aliens, not the undocumented kind. Again, one must tread lightly in our enlightened times.
